headline: Healthcare Stocks Drop After Trump Says ACA Funds Should Go to Public
summary: Shares in health insurers fell after President Trump said that federal funding paid to them under the Affordable Care Act should go directly to the public. Trump lambasted the "hundreds of billions of dollars" paid to "money-sucking" health insurers in Truth Social posts over the weekend.

raw.headline: Healthcare Stocks Drop After Trump Says ACA Funds Should Go to Public

Trump lambasted the "hundreds of billions of dollars" paid to "money-sucking" health insurers in Truth Social posts over the weekend.

headline: Why Molina Healthcare (MOH) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of healthcare insurance company Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) fell 7% in the afternoon session after President Donald Trump proposed a significant change to the Affordable Care Act (ACA), suggesting federal funds should go directly to people instead of health insurance companies. In social media posts, Trump called insurance companies “money sucking” and argued that people could purchase “much better, healthcare” if the funds were sent directly to them. headline: How is Teladoc Health Placed in the Growing Telemedicine Market?
summary: Teladoc Health is expanding its AI-powered virtual care capabilities as the telemedicine market surges toward massive U.S. growth.

headline: Health Insurers Are Left Behind as Shutdown Fight Winds Down
summary: Insurers and hospital stocks were tanking on Monday as a deal to end the government shutdown moved ahead without a clear path toward the extension of health-insurance subsidies the Democrats have demanded.  The subsidies, set to expire in less than two months, have dramatically reduced the cost of premiums for insurance plans bought on the Affordable Care Act marketplaces.  Now, open enrollment for next year’s plans is well under way.

headline: Health Insurer Stocks Slide on President Trump's Call to Change ACA Payments
summary: President Trump called on Congress to change the way the federal government helps Americans pay for health insurance.

headline: Health-Insurer Stocks Drop After Trump Says ACA Funds Should Go to Public
summary: Shares in health insurers fell after President Trump said that federal funding paid to them under the Affordable Care Act should go directly to the public. Trump lambasted the "hundreds of billions of dollars" paid to "money-sucking" health insurers in Truth Social posts over the weekend.

raw.headline: Health-Insurer Stocks Drop After Trump Says ACA Funds Should Go to Public
raw.summary: Shares in health insurers fell after President Trump said that federal funding paid to them under the Affordable Care Act should go directly to the public. Trump lambasted the "hundreds of billions of dollars" paid to "money-sucking" health insurers in Truth Social posts over the weekend.

headline: 'Money Sucking' S&P 500 Stocks Dive On Government Funding Deal
summary: Centene, the largest health insurer based on Affordable Care Act Marketplace enrollment and hospital operator HCA Healthcare were the worst-performing S&P 500 stocks early Monday after a weekend deal toward ending the government shutdown left the fate of expiring ACA subsidies unsettled.  Meanwhile, the overall S&P 500 rallied strongly on expectations that the government reopening will give the economy a needed shot in the arm.  The seven Democrats and one independent who joined 52 Republicans to advance a reopening bill could only extract a commitment to hold a vote on renewing the enhanced ACA subsidies.
